column5:
Merge pull request #78 from marcosscriven/master

Pin requirements.txt to working set, including older theano.

Merge pull request #82 from ajmeese7/patch-1

Update README.md

Merge pull request #80 from wqhIris/patch-1

Fixes parameters for function make_plots (wrong ordering of parameters), but doesn't change output, due to a lucky coincidence in earlier choice of parameters

Wrong paramter for function make_plots

Hi, this is a small change.
According to the definition of function make_plots, the top 3 paramters are not correct.
Pin requirements.txt to working set, including older theano.
Noting compatibility, and (lack of) future plans

Merge pull request #31 from mariuz/patch-1

Update requirements.txt

Update requirements.txt

add Theano to requirements

Merge pull request #20 from CesiumLifeJacket/master

removed numpy.vectorize() wrappers

Merge pull request #15 from drjerry/python-classes

python-izes classes

improved performance by using sigmoid and sigmoid_prime functions
directly, instead of wrapping them numpy's vectorize() function
python-izes classes to inherit base object instead of ()
adding hints on how to use conv.py
Fixing the basic relu results, adding the expanded data
Begin adding experiments involving conv nets
Tracking gradients in different layers, and serializing some MNIST images to JSON

Merge pull request #8 from kressi/master

sys imported
Improved comment explaining numerical stability issue
Fixing possible log of zero error
Redo plots for multiple values of eta, and add a second image of the gradient valley (this time without axis labels)
Updated parameterization for the more data plots
Regenerating overfitting and regularization data, with new parameterization
Redid the overfitting results with parameters that actually match what's in the text
Changing normalization of L2 regularization parameter
Lots of renaming to rationalize the organization of the code directory
Added save method and load function
Finished the results with multiple learning rates
Adding README for the replaced_by_d3 subdirectory
Renamed many of the figures replaced by d3, adding first commit of a program to plot behaviour with different learning rates
Reverting likely erroneous changes to the matrix arithmetic
Renaming network_basic, and making minor fixes to network2.py
Added comparison graph for SVMs running over many training set sizes
Added fudge factor which improves the appearance of the rotated MNIST 5
Adding log plot showing what happens when more training data is used
Adding figure of an MNIST digit and its rotated version
Adding a plot to show how more data improves training accuracy
Results for the regularized network trained on the full data set
Adding results for overfitting on full data set (much less is going on), plus a new graph
Modified overfitting.py to make it easier to run on varied data sets
Make the number of epochs to train for a parameter
Getting the overfitting graphs right (earlier versions weren't initializing the weights correctly)
Results for weight initialization comparison experiment
Comparative weight initialization now working pretty well
First draft of program to contrast results between different approaches to weight initialization
Refactoring network2.py, and added new option for weight initialization
Added regularization and ability to output multiple files
Improved overfitting results: more graphs, faster, easier to reproduce
Improved monitoring ability in network2, and did more comprehensive graphs in overfitting
Factored out the cost functions into separate classes

Merge pull request #3 from fhisamoto/master

Loads gziped mnist data file; Adds requirements.txt.
Removing figure about online learning (discussion moved to an exercise)

Merge pull request #5 from LefterisJP/issue_4

fixing issue #4 by restoring mnist training data
fixing issue #4 by restoring mnist training data
Separating backprop and SGD more cleanly
Removed size of training_data from backprop, and improved comment
Adds requirements.txt to know what are the project dependencies.
Added a plot of the really bad MNIST images
Added complete zero image from MNIST data
Added 10 by 10 array of MNIST digits
Rationalized the data format in mnist_loader, and minor improvements and simplifications for network_basic
Added graph for rectified linear unit
Adding plot for a deep autoencoder
Added plot of how the gradient of the cost function varies with layer
Refactoring and consolidating the feedforward methods
The error is now l1 error
Added computation of mean output activation
Added experimental work on finding common knowledge between two autoencoders
Added figure files illustrating why pca sometimes doesn't work so well
Added autoencoder code, and code to make it easier to propagate data
Fixing up the function to find the minimal cross entropy
Added a function computing the minimal cross entropy for a set of training data
I've now made it possible to tune and train nested autoencoders from the REPL.
Added doc strings for the deep autoencoder, and made it so the autoencoder can be retrained
Improving autoencoder, and added data directory
Renamed backprop2 to autoencoder, and started the autoencoder
Made cost function (and deriv) a parameter, and saner initialization for weights
Added backprop2.py and modified definition of lambda in backprop.py
Added link to mnist data.  Need to self-host
Added plot of cost versus epoch for various values of eta
Refactoring, making mnist_nn into backprop, and less MNIST dependent
Add a plot of the first MNIST digit
Major refactoring of mnist_nn.py, moved tests to separate file
Adding figure showing a sample of the SVM failed MNIST classifications
Factoring out the MNIST SVM classifier
Factoring out the MNIST loader and the average darkness classifier
Added feature plots for MNIST data
Improving the NN classification of MNIST data
Redid axes for trapped gradient descent image
Correcting computation of the cumulative update rule for backprop
Improved way of getting zero weight matrices
SPeeding up by preventing double computation
Added baseline to back_prop, and program to generate figure images
Began back-propagation digit recognition example with a couple of baselines (average darkness, SVM).
Added example to use to illustrate the failure of online learning
Added plots for the function which misleads gradient descent
Code and graph showing false minima for gradient descent
Fixed text of comments, and added an example where gradient descent gets trapped
First draft of gradient descent hack.  Plot still not working
Added 3d plot of a function to minimize
Added step function code and plot
Added grid to sigmoid plot, rescaled axes
Finished changing from list-based to numpy array-based data representation.  Doesn't much matter for this code, but in general it's better to use the vectorized approach.
